title: Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Deck Saloon and Stateroom", May 15, 1935
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower left: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower left: JOB # 530/ 3/8"-1'0 FOR PLAN./CENTAUR, Olsson/ 5/15/35; inscribed in graphite, center left: GLASS WALL WITH TWO DOORS; inscribed in graphite with dimensions and instructions
description: Plan and elevation for deck saloon and deck stateroom on Lady Esther Yacht. West wall of saloon in glass with two doors; descending staircase in upper left corner. Windows along north and south wall of saloon. Sliding doors between saloon and stateroom at right. Sofa bed in upper left corner of stateroom. Bathroom in upper right corner with toilet, sink, and shower. Closet on east wall.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Deck Saloon and Stateroom", May 15, 1935.
May 15, 1935. Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-428.
